  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).

item.description: Indulge in the delightful layers of this strawberry shortcake, perfect for warm-weather gatherings. With fluffy vanilla cake, juicy macerated strawberries, and airy whipped cream frosting, it's a dessert that will impress your guests. Gather your loved ones and enjoy this refreshing treat that satisfies every sweet tooth! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230294638 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup milk
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 cups strawberries, sliced
  • 1/4 cup sugar (for strawberries)
  • 1 cup heavy whipping cream
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
  2. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add softened butter, milk, and eggs, and mix until smooth.
  3. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
  4. While the cakes are baking, macerate the strawberries by mixing them with 1/4 cup sugar and letting them sit for 15 minutes.
  5. Once the cakes are cool, whip the heavy cream with vanilla extract until soft peaks form.
  6. Assemble the cake by placing one layer on a serving plate, topping it with macerated strawberries and whipped cream, then place the second layer on top and repeat.

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions
